segment.source: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) generates various reports to monitor BitLocker usage and compliance.
segment.target: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) generates various reports to monitor BitLocker usage and compliance.

segment.source: This topic describes the MBAM reports for enterprise compliance, individual computers, hardware compatibility, and key recovery activity.
segment.target: This topic describes the MBAM reports for enterprise compliance, individual computers, hardware compatibility, and key recovery activity.

segment.source: To access the Reports feature of MBAM, open the MBAM administration website.
segment.target: To access the Reports feature of MBAM, open the MBAM administration website.

segment.source: Select Reports in the navigation pane.
segment.target: Select Reports in the navigation pane.

segment.source: Then, in the main content pane, click the tab for your report type: Enterprise Compliance Report, Computer Compliance Report, Hardware Audit Report, or Recovery Audit Report.
segment.target: Then, in the main content pane, click the tab for your report type: Enterprise Compliance Report, Computer Compliance Report, Hardware Audit Report, or Recovery Audit Report.

segment.source: An Enterprise Compliance Report provides information on overall BitLocker compliance in your organization.
segment.target: An Enterprise Compliance Report provides information on overall BitLocker compliance in your organization.

segment.source: The available filters for this report allow you to narrow your search results according to Compliance state and Error status.
segment.target: The available filters for this report allow you to narrow your search results according to Compliance state and Error status.

segment.source: This report runs every six hours.
segment.target: This report runs every six hours.

segment.source: The user-specified DNS name that is being managed by MBAM.
segment.target: The user-specified DNS name that is being managed by MBAM.

segment.source: The fully qualified domain name where the client computer resides and is managed by MBAM.
segment.target: The fully qualified domain name where the client computer resides and is managed by MBAM.

segment.source: The state of compliance for the computer, according to the policy specified for the computer.
segment.target: The state of compliance for the computer, according to the policy specified for the computer.

segment.source: The possible states are Noncompliant and Compliant.
segment.target: The possible states are Noncompliant and Compliant.

segment.source: For more information, see Enterprise Compliance Report Compliance States in this topic.
segment.target: For more information, see Enterprise Compliance Report Compliance States in this topic.

segment.source: The state of the computer hardware for determining the identification of the hardware type and whether the computer is exempt from policy.
segment.target: The state of the computer hardware for determining the identification of the hardware type and whether the computer is exempt from policy.

segment.source: There are three possible states: Hardware Unknown (the hardware type has not been identified by MBAM), Hardware Exempt (the hardware type was identified and was marked as exempt from MBAM policy), and Not Exempt (the hardware was identified and is not exempt from policy).
segment.target: There are three possible states: Hardware Unknown (the hardware type has not been identified by MBAM), Hardware Exempt (the hardware type was identified and was marked as exempt from MBAM policy), and Not Exempt (the hardware was identified and is not exempt from policy).

segment.source: Known users on the computer that is being managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Known users on the computer that is being managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Error and status messages about the compliance state of the computer in accordance to the specified policy.
segment.target: Error and status messages about the compliance state of the computer in accordance to the specified policy.

segment.source: Date and time when the computer last contacted the server to report compliance status.
segment.target: Date and time when the computer last contacted the server to report compliance status.

segment.source: The computer is noncompliant according to the specified policy, and the hardware type has not been indicated as exempt from policy.
segment.target: The computer is noncompliant according to the specified policy, and the hardware type has not been indicated as exempt from policy.

segment.source: Click Computer Name to expand the Computer Compliance Report and determine whether the state of each drive complies with the specified policy.
segment.target: Click Computer Name to expand the Computer Compliance Report and determine whether the state of each drive complies with the specified policy.

segment.source: If the encryption state indicates that the computer is not encrypted, encryption might still be in process, or there might be an error on the computer.
segment.target: If the encryption state indicates that the computer is not encrypted, encryption might still be in process, or there might be an error on the computer.

segment.source: If there is no error, the likely cause is that the computer is still in the process of connecting or establishing the encryption status.
segment.target: If there is no error, the likely cause is that the computer is still in the process of connecting or establishing the encryption status.

segment.source: Check back later to determine if the state changes.
segment.target: Check back later to determine if the state changes.

segment.source: The computer is compliant in accordance with the specified policy.
segment.target: The computer is compliant in accordance with the specified policy.

segment.source: Optionally, you can view the Computer Compliance Report to confirm the state of the computer.
segment.target: Optionally, you can view the Computer Compliance Report to confirm the state of the computer.

segment.source: If the Hardware type is exempt.
segment.target: If the Hardware type is exempt.

segment.source: Regardless of how the policy is set or the individual status of each hard-drive, the overall state is considered to be compliant.
segment.target: Regardless of how the policy is set or the individual status of each hard-drive, the overall state is considered to be compliant.

segment.source: MBAM recognizes the hardware type, but MBAM does not know whether it is exempt or not exempt.
segment.target: MBAM recognizes the hardware type, but MBAM does not know whether it is exempt or not exempt.

segment.source: This occurs if the administrator has not set the Compatible status for the hardware.
segment.target: This occurs if the administrator has not set the Compatible status for the hardware.

segment.source: Therefore, MBAM reverts to Compliant status by default.
segment.target: Therefore, MBAM reverts to Compliant status by default.

segment.source: This is the initial state of a newly deployed MBAM client.
segment.target: This is the initial state of a newly deployed MBAM client.

segment.source: It is typically only a transient state.
segment.target: It is typically only a transient state.

segment.source: Even if the administrator has marked the Hardware as Compatible, there can be a significant delay or configurable wait time before the client computer reports back in.
segment.target: Even if the administrator has marked the Hardware as Compatible, there can be a significant delay or configurable wait time before the client computer reports back in.

segment.source: Make note of the time of Last Contact, and check in again after the specified interval to see if the state has changed.
segment.target: Make note of the time of Last Contact, and check in again after the specified interval to see if the state has changed.

segment.source: If the state has not changed, there may be an error for this computer or hardware type.
segment.target: If the state has not changed, there may be an error for this computer or hardware type.

segment.source: The Computer Compliance Report displays information that is specific to a computer or user.
segment.target: The Computer Compliance Report displays information that is specific to a computer or user.

segment.source: The Computer Compliance Report provides detailed encryption information and applicable policies for each drive on a computer, including operating system drives and fixed data drives.
segment.target: The Computer Compliance Report provides detailed encryption information and applicable policies for each drive on a computer, including operating system drives and fixed data drives.

segment.source: To view this report type, click the computer name in the Enterprise Compliance Report or type the computer name in the Computer Compliance Report.
segment.target: To view this report type, click the computer name in the Enterprise Compliance Report or type the computer name in the Computer Compliance Report.

segment.source: To view the details of each drive, expand the Computer Name entry.
segment.target: To view the details of each drive, expand the Computer Name entry.

segment.source: This report does not provide encryption status for Removable Data Volumes.
segment.target: This report does not provide encryption status for Removable Data Volumes.

segment.source: The user-specified DNS computer name that is being managed by MBAM.
segment.target: The user-specified DNS computer name that is being managed by MBAM.

segment.source: The fully qualified domain name where the client computer resides and is managed by MBAM.
segment.target: The fully qualified domain name where the client computer resides and is managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Valid types are non-Portable and Portable.
segment.target: Valid types are non-Portable and Portable.

segment.source: Operating System type installed on the MBAM managed client computer.
segment.target: Operating System type installed on the MBAM managed client computer.

segment.source: The overall Compliance Status of the computer managed by MBAM.
segment.target: The overall Compliance Status of the computer managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Valid states are Compliant and Noncompliant.
segment.target: Valid states are Compliant and Noncompliant.

segment.source: While it is possible to have Compliant and Noncompliant drives in the same computer, this field indicates the overall computer compliance per specified policy.
segment.target: While it is possible to have Compliant and Noncompliant drives in the same computer, this field indicates the overall computer compliance per specified policy.

segment.source: The Cipher Strength selected by the Administrator during MBAM policy specification.
segment.target: The Cipher Strength selected by the Administrator during MBAM policy specification.

segment.source: Indicates whether encryption is required for the O/S and the protector type as applicable.
segment.target: Indicates whether encryption is required for the O/S and the protector type as applicable.

segment.source: Indicates whether encryption is required for the Fixed Drive.
segment.target: Indicates whether encryption is required for the Fixed Drive.

segment.source: Indicates whether encryption is required for the Removable Drive.
segment.target: Indicates whether encryption is required for the Removable Drive.

segment.source: Provides the identity of known users on the computer.
segment.target: Provides the identity of known users on the computer.

segment.source: Indicates whether the computer hardware type is recognized by MBAM and, if known, whether the computer has been indicated as exempt from policy.
segment.target: Indicates whether the computer hardware type is recognized by MBAM and, if known, whether the computer has been indicated as exempt from policy.

segment.source: There are three states: Hardware Unknown (the hardware type has not been identified by MBAM); Hardware Exempt (the hardware type was identified and was marked as exempt from MBAM policy); and Not Exempt (the hardware was identified and is not exempt from policy).
segment.target: There are three states: Hardware Unknown (the hardware type has not been identified by MBAM); Hardware Exempt (the hardware type was identified and was marked as exempt from MBAM policy); and Not Exempt (the hardware was identified and is not exempt from policy).

segment.source: The computer manufacturer name as it appears in the computer BIOS.
segment.target: The computer manufacturer name as it appears in the computer BIOS.

segment.source: The computer manufacturer model name as it appears in the computer BIOS.
segment.target: The computer manufacturer model name as it appears in the computer BIOS.

segment.source: Error and status messages of the compliance state of the computer in accordance with the specified policy.
segment.target: Error and status messages of the compliance state of the computer in accordance with the specified policy.

segment.source: Date and time that the computer last contacted the server to report compliance status.
segment.target: Date and time that the computer last contacted the server to report compliance status.

segment.source: Computer drive letter that was assigned to this particular drive by the user.
segment.target: Computer drive letter that was assigned to this particular drive by the user.

segment.source: Valid values are Operating System Drive and Fixed Data Drive.
segment.target: Valid values are Operating System Drive and Fixed Data Drive.

segment.source: These are physical drives rather than logical volumes.
segment.target: These are physical drives rather than logical volumes.

segment.source: Cipher Strength selected by the Administrator during MBAM policy specification.
segment.target: Cipher Strength selected by the Administrator during MBAM policy specification.

segment.source: Type of protector selected via policy used to encrypt an operating system or Fixed volume.
segment.target: Type of protector selected via policy used to encrypt an operating system or Fixed volume.

segment.source: The valid protector types on an operating system drive are TPM or TPM+PIN.
segment.target: The valid protector types on an operating system drive are TPM or TPM+PIN.

segment.source: The only valid protector type for a Fixed Data Volume is Password.
segment.target: The only valid protector type for a Fixed Data Volume is Password.

segment.source: This field indicates whether the computer has enabled the protector type specified in the policy.
segment.target: This field indicates whether the computer has enabled the protector type specified in the policy.

segment.source: The valid states are ON or OFF.
segment.target: The valid states are ON or OFF.

segment.source: This is the current encryption state of the drive.
segment.target: This is the current encryption state of the drive.

segment.source: Valid states are Encrypted, Not Encrypted, and Encrypting.
segment.target: Valid states are Encrypted, Not Encrypted, and Encrypting.

segment.source: Indicates whether the drive is in accordance with the policy.
segment.target: Indicates whether the drive is in accordance with the policy.

segment.source: Contains error and status messages regarding the compliance state of the computer.
segment.target: Contains error and status messages regarding the compliance state of the computer.

segment.source: This report can help you audit changes to the Hardware Compatibility status of specific computer makes and models.
segment.target: This report can help you audit changes to the Hardware Compatibility status of specific computer makes and models.

segment.source: To help you narrow your search results, this report includes filtering on criteria such as type of change and time of occurrence.
segment.target: To help you narrow your search results, this report includes filtering on criteria such as type of change and time of occurrence.

segment.source: Each state change is tracked by user and date and time.
segment.target: Each state change is tracked by user and date and time.

segment.source: The Hardware Type is automatically populated by the MBAM agent that runs on the client computer.
segment.target: The Hardware Type is automatically populated by the MBAM agent that runs on the client computer.

segment.source: This report tracks user changes to the information collected directly from the MBAM managed computer.
segment.target: This report tracks user changes to the information collected directly from the MBAM managed computer.

segment.source: A typical administrative change is changing from Compatible to incompatible.
segment.target: A typical administrative change is changing from Compatible to incompatible.

segment.source: However, the administrator can also revise any field.
segment.target: However, the administrator can also revise any field.

segment.source: Date and time that a change was made to the Hardware Type.
segment.target: Date and time that a change was made to the Hardware Type.

segment.source: Note that every unique hardware type is assigned to at least one entry.
segment.target: Note that every unique hardware type is assigned to at least one entry.

segment.source: Administrative user that has made the change for the particular entry.
segment.target: Administrative user that has made the change for the particular entry.

segment.source: Type of change that was made to the hardware type information.
segment.target: Type of change that was made to the hardware type information.

segment.source: Valid values are Addition (new entry), Update (change existing entry), or Deletion (remove existing entry).
segment.target: Valid values are Addition (new entry), Update (change existing entry), or Deletion (remove existing entry).

segment.source: Value of the hardware type specification before the change was made.
segment.target: Value of the hardware type specification before the change was made.

segment.source: Value of the hardware type specification after the change was made.
segment.target: Value of the hardware type specification after the change was made.

segment.source: The Recovery Audit Report can help you audit users who have requested access to recovery keys.
segment.target: The Recovery Audit Report can help you audit users who have requested access to recovery keys.

segment.source: The filter criteria for this report includes type of user making the request, type of key requested, time of occurrence, success or fail, time of occurrence, and type of user requesting (help desk, end user).
segment.target: The filter criteria for this report includes type of user making the request, type of key requested, time of occurrence, success or fail, time of occurrence, and type of user requesting (help desk, end user).

segment.source: This report enables administrators to produce contextual reports based on need.
segment.target: This report enables administrators to produce contextual reports based on need.

segment.source: The date and time that a key retrieval request was made by an end user or help desk user.
segment.target: The date and time that a key retrieval request was made by an end user or help desk user.

segment.source: Valid statuses are either Successful (the key was retrieved) or Failed (the key was not retrieved).
segment.target: Valid statuses are either Successful (the key was retrieved) or Failed (the key was not retrieved).

segment.source: The help desk user who initiated the request for key retrieval.
segment.target: The help desk user who initiated the request for key retrieval.

segment.source: If the help desk user retrieves the key on behalf of an end user, the End User field will be blank.
segment.target: If the help desk user retrieves the key on behalf of an end user, the End User field will be blank.

segment.source: The end user who initiated the request for key retrieval.
segment.target: The end user who initiated the request for key retrieval.

segment.source: The type of key that was requested.
segment.target: The type of key that was requested.

segment.source: MBAM collects three key types: Recovery Key Password (to recovery a computer in recovery mode); Recovery Key ID (to recover a computer in recovery mode on behalf of another user); and Trusted Platform Module (TPM) Password Hash (to recover a computer with a locked TPM).
segment.target: MBAM collects three key types: Recovery Key Password (to recovery a computer in recovery mode); Recovery Key ID (to recover a computer in recovery mode on behalf of another user); and Trusted Platform Module (TPM) Password Hash (to recover a computer with a locked TPM).

segment.source: The reason that the specified Key Type was requested.
segment.target: The reason that the specified Key Type was requested.

segment.source: The reasons are specified in the Drive Recovery and Manage TPM features of the Administrative web site.
segment.target: The reasons are specified in the Drive Recovery and Manage TPM features of the Administrative web site.

segment.source: Valid entries include user-entered text or one of the following reason codes:
segment.target: Valid entries include user-entered text or one of the following reason codes:

segment.source: To save report results to a file, click the Export button on the reports menu bar.
segment.target: To save report results to a file, click the Export button on the reports menu bar.

segment.source: Monitoring and Reporting BitLocker Compliance with MBAM 1.0
segment.target: Monitoring and Reporting BitLocker Compliance with MBAM 1.0
